name: EDAL
tagline: ncWMS and the Environmental Data Abstraction Layer libraries.
body:
## What is ncWMS?
ncWMS is a [Web Map Service](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_Map_Service) for displaying environmental data

## What is EDAL?
EDAL is the Environmental Data Abstraction Layer - a set of libraries which provide a data model for dealing with environmental datatypes, and numerous utility routines for reading, manipulating, and plotting this data, as well as serving it over a WMS.

## Getting started with ncWMS
ncWMS is designed to run in a servlet container such as [Tomcat](http://tomcat.apache.org/) or [Glassfish](https://glassfish.java.net/).  However, we do provide a standalone version which uses an embedded [Winstone](http://winstone.sourceforge.net/) servlet container to allow users to quickly try it out.

The standalone version can be run from the command line using the command:
```
java -jar ncWMS-2.0-standalone.jar
```
This will run the embedded servlet container with ncWMS.  You can access the web interface to ncWMS at [http://localhost:8080/](http://localhost:8080/)

### Developing ncWMS
ncWMS can be extended in a number of ways for custom behaviour.  These include:
* Adding new colour palettes
* Precisely defining new styles using custom [SLDs](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Styled_Layer_Descriptor)
* Adding readers for new data formats
* Adding plugins to perform on-the-fly manipulation of existing data layers
